}} 'The Scheme' is a BBC Scotland BAFTA-award winning http://www.westsound.co.uk/news/-the-scheme--wins-a-scottish-
bafta/ documentary series which follows the lives of six families on the
Onthank and Knockinlaw housing schemes in Kilmarnock. The series has been the
subject of media criticism, with the series being labelled as "poverty porn"
[http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv-and-
radio/tvandradioblog/2010/may/28/the-scheme-bbc The Scheme: gritty TV or poverty
porn?], The Guardian TV & Radio Blog, Friday 28 May 2010 [http://thescotsman.scotsman.com/features/The-
Scheme-A-brutal-eyeopener.6322501.jp The Scheme: A brutal eye-opener or poverty
porn]? ,The Scotsman, 28 May 2010 and described as giving a "misleading
impression" of life on the estate. [http://news.stv.tv/scotland/west-central/178444-debate-
over-housing-estate-portrayal-on-the-scheme/ Debate over housing estate
portrayal on 'The Scheme'], stv.tv, 19 May 2010 [http://news.scotsman.com/glasgow/The-Scheme-a-TV-
documentary.6302957.jp The Scheme, a TV documentary of life on a Kilmarnock
estate, has already been dubbed Scotland's Shameless. But what's life really
like there?], Scotsman, 20 May 2010

The programme makers have denied allegations that their series exploits the
residents of the estate. [http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-
news/2010/05/30/producers-of-bbc-series-the-scheme-hits-back-after-msp-blasts-
show-86908-22297193/ Producers of BBC series The Scheme hits back after MSP
blasts show], Sunday Mail, 30 May 2010
